column4: I managed to get through the graphical login after I deinstalled gdm
then I got into xterm, reinstalled gdm and opened gnome-manager
what do I do from here?
I'm like an earthworm worming his way through XD
basically I need to get normal gnome system back so I can log into that
which makes sense because I'm in gnome
only I got there through xterm
and I don't see my normal panels and stuff
what happened that you doing this?
you couldn't login, so how did you get an xterm?
i am NOT an expert but what you MIGHT try is backing up your entire home directory, completely uninstall gnome and reinstall from scratch
then when it works (if it works) you put your home dir back - and hopefully what's screwed up isn't in a config file there
i would do that from a console
and there is a lot of stuff to remove and put back - i don't know the names of the packages and you won't have synaptic there to tell you - it might be easier to reload ubuntu
i have been learning about these things lately
